page.title: 08 THE COALITE
page.content: {Askern Coalite}was opened in{1929}by {King George V. }The coalite carbonises raw coal, turning it into a smokeless fuel. During the process coal oils are produced. After this process the raw coal is now coalite, which is a smokeless fuel. The coalite has about 325 men employed. Their products are shipped all over the{British Isles}and exports go to Scandinavia and Venezuela. During the miners' strike production levels were reduced to match the coal available. The stocks they keep vary throughout the year. Maximum totals of all grades of fuel will be in the tens of thousands of tonnes. Coal stocks also run into the tens of thousands of tonnes.
